In Hungary, a decade of dismantling asylum rights
subhead: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (1/5). In response to the arrival of hundreds of thousands of asylum seekers in the summer of 2015, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban built a fence in the south of the country to push them away.

Temperatures drop slightly in Europe as brutal heatwave nears end
subhead: Paris hit 40°C on Tuesday, but the high will drop to 35°C on Wednesday and to 28°C on Thursday.

headline: ChatGPT use significantly reduces brain activity, an MIT study finds
subhead: This preliminary, non-peer-reviewed study highlights that among students tasked with writing and memorizing a series of essays, those who relied solely on ChatGPT showed a decline in neural, linguistic and behavioral skills after four months. The findings have sparked debate within the field of artificial intelligence.

headline: US will halt some key weapons shipments of military aid to Ukraine
subhead: The delivery of munitions and other military aid had been promised under the Biden administration. Missiles for Patriot air defense systems, precision artillery and Hellfire missiles are among the items being held back.

headline: Inside the world of the Yahoo Boys, Africa's most infamous romance scammers
subhead: Did you hear about the woman who thought she was going out with Brad Pitt? That was them. In Nigeria, online romance scams have become a multimillion-dollar industry − and an easy way to get rich.

Israel limits entry of baby formula in Gaza as infants die of hunger
subhead: While waiting to enter Gaza on a medical aid mission, an American doctor watched Israeli security forces confiscate the cans of powdered baby formula packed in his luggage. The vital product is desperately lacking in the Palestinian enclave, where about 50 children have died of hunger since March.

headline: Rekindled love: 'I passionately fall in love with her and then, like a complete coward, I break her heart'
subhead: They met, fell in love and separated. And then the whirl of life brought them back together. Igor, 61, tells us of his reunion with Gabrielle.

headline: The scientists tracking Himalayan glaciers' melting: 'Yala holds a very special place in my heart'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (2/6): The mountain range is home to 54,000 of the planet's 200,000 glaciers, whose accelerating melting threatens locals and worries scientists. Researchers are seeking means for the challenging research expeditions crucial to understanding Nepal's ice masses.
